body: HAVE_ATOMIC is independent of Win32 and sufficient if the test compiles and runs correctly. So that leaves only the unsupported math expression which should be supported from CMake 3.13 onward.
@mback2k but we require cmake >= 3.2 in the `cmake_minimum_required`, so isn't it weird to assume users have >= 3.13?
Oh, I must have missed that. I will try to find a workaround or fallback for earlier versions then.

issue.title: cmake: skip superfluous hex2dec conversion using math expr

repository.name: curl
repository.description: A command line tool and library for transferring data with URL syntax, supporting DICT, FILE, FTP, FTPS, GOPHER, GOPHERS, HTTP, HTTPS, IMAP, IMAPS, LDAP, LDAPS, MQTT, POP3, POP3S, RTMP, RTMPS, RTSP, SCP, SFTP, SMB, SMBS, SMTP, SMTPS, TELNET, TFTP, WS and WSS. libcurl offers a myriad of powerful features

issue.body:
CMake seems to be able to compare two hex values just fine.
Also make sure CURL_TARGET_WINDOWS_VERSION is respected.

Assisted-by: Marcel Raad
Reviewed-by: Viktor Szakats
Reported-by: Keitagit-kun on github

Fixes https://github.com/curl/curl/issues/9406

body:
I had the exact same issue.
In my case it turned out that _WIN32_WINNT was not defined at all.
That's what's causing math(EXPR...) to fail.
Make sure you define it using `-D_WIN32_WINNT=0x0601` or something like that...
`_WIN32_WINNT` should _always_ be defined if `WIN32` is defined. @negrutiu please check if #9411 solves this issue for you.

Hi @mback2k. Unfortunately #9411 doesn't seem to solve this issue.

In my project both `WIN32` and `CURL_TARGET_WINDOWS_VERSION` are defined as cmake variables.
The line `add_definitions(-D_WIN32_WINNT=${CURL_TARGET_WINDOWS_VERSION})` (CMakeLists.txt:88) gets executed but it doesn't seem to have any effect. The -D_WIN32_WINNT definition **is not** passed to the C compiler and the issue persists.

I'm no **cmake** expert but the only workaround I've found was passing `_WIN32_WINNT` directly to the compiler, something like: `cmake -G "NMake Makefiles" [...] -DCMAKE_C_FLAGS="-D_WIN32_WINNT=0x0602"`.

It's worth metioning that this issue occurs when building with Visual Studio (2019 in my case).
The same source code builds successfully with **msys2/mingw**.

I can't reproduce.
With
```
cmake [...] -G "NMake Makefiles" -DCURL_TARGET_WINDOWS_VERSION=0x0502 -DENABLE_DEBUG=ON -DENABLE_WERROR=ON
```
I get in all flags.make:
```
C_DEFINES = -DBUILDING_LIBCURL -DCURLDEBUG -DCURL_HIDDEN_SYMBOLS -DDEBUGBUILD -DHAVE_CONFIG_H -D_CRT_NONSTDC_NO_DEPRECATE -D_CRT_SECURE_NO_DEPRECATE -D_WIN32_WINNT=0x0502 -Dlibcurl_EXPORTS
```

What does that line look like for you @negrutiu ? Can you show us your CMakeOutput.log?

Ahhh, this is embarrasing... I've started everything from scratch, pulled latest master and now everything seems build fine.
I must have had something out-of-sync somewhere. Sorry guys for the false alarm.
My final conclusions:
- This particular issue was caused by `CURL_TARGET_WINDOWS_VERSION` being **undefined** in my project
- Defining CURL_TARGET_WINDOWS_VERSION will automatically/internally define  `_WIN32_WINNT` as well

Thanks everyone for your support.
